4ad4189e-fa42-4af6-917e-b2167b09ab0d.description: The Washington University Data Analytics Boot Camp is a part-time 24 week program that empowers you to gain the knowledge and skills to conduct robust analytics on a host of real-world problems.
4ad4189e-fa42-4af6-917e-b2167b09ab0d.name: Data Analytics Boot Camp

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: Throughout the course, you’ll be gaining proficiencies on a host of marketable technologies like Advanced Excel, Python, JavaScript, (D3.js, Leaflet.js), HTML/CSS, API Interactions, Social Media Mining, SQL, Tableau, Advanced Statistics, Machine Learning, R, Git/GitHub and more. Plus, you’ll have an impressive Professional Portfolio and the confidence you need to succeed in the data driven economy.

98a2f8e2-66b8-4466-89c5-e035eaa18e60.description: The Technical Leadership Certificate delivers techniques to motivate and inspire, tools to manage conflict and strategies to lead through influence. 6 courses are required, plus 1 course from 5 different core competency groups, for a total of 11 courses.
98a2f8e2-66b8-4466-89c5-e035eaa18e60.name: Technical Leadership Certificate

7845b52f-d9dc-4b5b-ae44-3bf2abeb2225.description: The 24-week Washington University Cybersecurity Boot Camp is a challenging, part-time program that takes a multidisciplinary approach to attaining proficiency in IT, networking, and modern information security.
7845b52f-d9dc-4b5b-ae44-3bf2abeb2225.name: Cybersecurity Boot Camp

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: Participants gain experience with a host of popular tools such as Wireshark, Kali Linux, Metasploit, Nessus, and more. In addition, students will learn skills applicable to certifications such as the CompTIA Security+ and Certified Ethical Hacker (CEH), which can greatly enhance desirability and employability in today’s job market. You will also learn methods, techniques, and best practices for convincingly conveying the severity of the risks facing an organization’s security posture.

81648281-54e8-44a0-bb91-7325222aae93.description: The 24-week Washington University Coding Boot Camp is an online, part-time Full Stack Flex course that gives you the knowledge and skills to build dynamic end-to-end web applications and become a full stack web developer.
81648281-54e8-44a0-bb91-7325222aae93.name: Coding Boot Camp

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: Participants complete a rigorous, fast-paced program that covers both theory and application of web development. Learners gain proficiency by building complex projects under the guidance of professional web developers. Throughout this program, learners develop a professional portfolio and the confidence to succeed as a web development professional.

5abff925-7139-40e5-a99e-f1bc0df294f8.description: This series of courses use a behavioral profiling tool to help participants identify their strengths by focusing on the behaviors that "come naturally" to them. When leaders operate from their strengths and are aware of their weaknesses, they can more effectively coach, delegate, and correct performance problems. This series covers verbal, non-verbal, written, and other communication styles.
5abff925-7139-40e5-a99e-f1bc0df294f8.name: Communication Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: Writing, Speaking and Presenting with Confidence

38c8f473-40d8-4377-ae5a-4f72baf09191.description: A coaching culture emphasizes the skills of seeking and listening versus telling someone what to do. When asked for their input, peers and employees feel free to challenge and provoke thinking or offer solutions that might not have been considered. Given the chaotic and fast-changing business environment, having leaders at all levels of the organization (not just those at the very top) coaching each other can provide greater agility to solve problems across the enterprise.
38c8f473-40d8-4377-ae5a-4f72baf09191.name: Coaching Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

545ef04d-5136-4b23-88e0-43b981679608.description: Change is a constant in business—a good thing. There are business opportunities to explore, new technologies to implement, and different work processes to invent that can save time, money, and aggravation. Research shows that approximately 70 percent of workplace changes fail shortly after they are implemented. The number may actually be higher. Driving change in the workplace is less about the process and more about people.
545ef04d-5136-4b23-88e0-43b981679608.name: Change Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

27eeff03-c327-47b2-b3d1-21a58ae04ce4.description: Business Analysts: The people who drive value creation. Develop well-qualified business analysts with this certificate. Courses focus on identifying stakeholder needs, guiding solution design and writing effective requirements to improve project outcomes. Special attention is given to IT project management.
27eeff03-c327-47b2-b3d1-21a58ae04ce4.name: Business Analysis Essentials

Critical Skills for Writing Better Requirements

420c4a9f-5f2d-425e-9d91-f1a65e753207.description: Experienced business analysts elevate their transferable skills with this certificate. We take your ability to elicit and analyze requirements to the next level and prepare you to provide strategic direction, report on performance metrics and ensure deliverables are met. Participants can use this and the Business Analysis Essentials certificate to prepare for designation as a Certified Business Analysis Professional (CBAP).
420c4a9f-5f2d-425e-9d91-f1a65e753207.name: Business Analysis Tools & Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

b59b7ee2-95ae-43cc-a675-e6957f9b02f5.description: Performance management, more than ever, is a shared process—although majority-owned by employees. Employees should play a role in setting their own goals and actively seeking feedback and coaching around their performance. And, even more importantly, they should take the lead in crafting and following through on their own development plans.
b59b7ee2-95ae-43cc-a675-e6957f9b02f5.name: Performance Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

c5914c2e-67db-4f4d-9403-cd419dedb6e1.description: Through a combination of coursework and real-world application, participants will be equipped with the skills to excel in this critical field. Distinguished by its unique, real-world curriculum and instructors, the ECLP addresses enterprise-level operational and high-priority cybersecurity management issues, while integrating ongoing leadership skills development. The ECLP is designed for executive and rising executive cybersecurity and IT professionals.
c5914c2e-67db-4f4d-9403-cd419dedb6e1.name: Executive Cybersecurity Leadership Program (ECLP)

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: In this ground-breaking course you'll build your executive toolkit and broaden your expertise at the level of the enterprise. You’ll emerge with deeper understanding of the strategic organizational environment and build the intellectual sophistication needed to provide the direction and make the decisions required for executive-level leadership in the cybersecurity space.

c0c8b11c-1274-4966-99bf-c05028c2f654.description: This certificate gives new project managers and team members critical job skills including schedule management, cost management, team motivation and problem solving. Participants learn to apply their knowledge using real-world scenarios and can use these courses to prepare for the Project Management Institute’s Project Management Professional certification (PMP).
c0c8b11c-1274-4966-99bf-c05028c2f654.name: Project Management Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: Taking the Risk out of Risk Management

e2f15f92-6df1-4f9f-aa12-5440f7262e34.description: Conflict management is the practice of dealing with disputes in a balanced, rational, and effective way. Since conflicts in a business are a natural part of the workplace, it is important that there are people who understand conflicts and know how to resolve them. This is important in today's market more than ever. Everyone is striving to show how valuable they are to the company they work for and at times, this can lead to disputes with other members of the team.
e2f15f92-6df1-4f9f-aa12-5440f7262e34.name: Conflict Management Certificate

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

b457bb89-edf8-4f3c-ae7d-7560a034aabb.description: The Health Care Operational Excellence program is a high-impact, non-degree certificate program teaching leaders from all levels and aspects of health care the process techniques and essential skills needed to approach today’s most complex performance improvement and operational challenges. Throughout the series, participants learn and implement a disciplined methodology for process improvement, envisioning the best solutions, and making better choices, even in the face of uncertainty.
b457bb89-edf8-4f3c-ae7d-7560a034aabb.name: Health Care Operational Excellence

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

badge_template_activities.title: This course is designed to give students on overview of operational excellence methods and tools. Specific focus is placed on the operational definition and history of operational excellence in healthcare. Students will learn the fundamentals of operational excellence principles and how the organizational complexities, regulatory and economic framework, and nuances of healthcare impact the ability to apply them.

Students will explore how to facilitate team processes to maximize productivity and results. The course will addresses how to get things done when teams lack leadership or authority. Supporting topics include how to build teams, how to manage meetings, how to build relationships beyond the team, and how to keep teams effective over their life span. Integrates strategy and organizational due diligence with facilitation and change strategies.

This course is a practical and experiential orientation to project management processes and methodology specifically as applied to healthcare. Participants will engage in project initiation including organizational alignment and charter development. Project planning will include elicitation of stakeholder requirements, development of work breakdown structure, scheduling and resourcing. Participants will also build competency in project execution, monitoring, and controlling.

This course will provide you with an understanding of lean methodologies and tools. You will gain the ability to identify the root cause of problems, apply the appropriate tools and develop systematic improvements. The PDCA/PDSA method and how to apply it will be discussed. You will learn the essential elements of a Lean Management System and how to accomplish sustainable results while developing a continuous improvement culture.

This course provides a foundation in Six Sigma and the tools associated with the 5 DMAIC phases (Define, Measure, Analyze, Improve and Control). You will understand the technical, behavioral and application aspects of data analytics. Skill acquired will help you effectively collect and analysis data in order to implement actions to improve and sustain results.

b4d4fca6-ba69-48b4-a472-735d50eedbf5.description: New developers and established IT security professionals alike will benefit from this comprehensive cybersecurity certificate. It starts with foundational concepts including risk assessment, security architecture and access control, then digs deep into incident response and application security to provide the skills to eliminate threats and engineer appropriate responses.
b4d4fca6-ba69-48b4-a472-735d50eedbf5.name: Cybersecurity Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

4359cb46-f0b9-49d1-aefc-4b5c46da937d.description: The ability to analyze network traffic is one of the most in-demand skills in cybersecurity. To earn this certificate, participants will use Wireshark to perform network traffic analysis. Techniques that cyber criminals use in the real world will be examined, demonstrated and practiced. Common malware tactics round out the curriculum, making it ideal for developers and IT managers.
4359cb46-f0b9-49d1-aefc-4b5c46da937d.name: Cybersecurity Tools & Techniques

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

531c7e11-ba64-466f-ab2b-bffff0992398.description: This certificate provides the skills for scheduling, estimating and executing projects successfully. Project managers and team members will use Microsoft Project to learn critical path scheduling, resource leveling and handling project overruns. Participants can use these courses to prepare for the Project Management Institute’s Project Management Professional certification (PMP).
531c7e11-ba64-466f-ab2b-bffff0992398.name: Project Management Tools & Techniques

e6a4013c-19c1-4f2a-9c9c-8c0a75d6e938.description: The Agile Coaching track explores the mindset, stances, and skills needed for effective facilitation, coaching, mentoring, and teaching in an agile team context. More importantly, it emphasizes the self-awareness and self-management required to navigate among these stances in service of teams, and to serve as a role model of agile values and principles. The track also focuses on guiding a team's journey from startup to high-performance.
e6a4013c-19c1-4f2a-9c9c-8c0a75d6e938.name: Agile Coaching

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

68efd6cd-bf72-43ff-8d57-330eaf74f898.description: This certificate introduces core agile concepts such as servant leadership, adaptive planning, frequent feedback for learning, and a focus on value-driven versus plan-driven delivery. Courses compare and contrast agile management with traditional management approaches and give participants principles and tools to apply in their teams and organizations.
68efd6cd-bf72-43ff-8d57-330eaf74f898.name: Delivery Management

issuer.summary: issued by Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

entity.name: Technology & Leadership Center at Washington University in St. Louis

e35b2833-96ff-4c3c-81f7-1ae2a0a6d00e.description: The DevOps Track explores the change in mindset and process from traditional approaches, much more so if the organization is not already embracing Agile principles. The organization must adopt a collaborative approach that brings everyone involved in delivery together, not just Development and Operations.
e35b2833-96ff-4c3c-81f7-1ae2a0a6d00e.name: DevOps
